post.text: I've created tens of thousands of jobs and I'm really good at it. As President, I WILL get America back to work! #MakeAmericaWorkAgain

comment.author: Mattie
comment.text: As an Independent on the fence, I thought Melania delivered a very well spoken and powerful speech, shifting my lean towards Trump...that is until I saw her side by side speech comparison with the current first ladies 2008 Democratic speech. Totally plagiarized. I'm not saying I'm now voting for Hillary, but this is a big blow to the Trump campaign. Not only did she plagiarize from Michelle almost verbatim but Michelle's speech writer was also Hillary's ex speech writer. Turns out Donalds only highlight from the first day of the convention turns out to be the most embarrassing. Hopefully he'll be able to shake this off.

replies.author: Patrick
replies.text: She said the same thing in an interview with Greta a few months ago. Just a coincidence of a few words

replies.author: Cassandra
replies.text: How about Trump's experience? We heard an awful lot about Obama's lack of experience 8 years ago, but the people who shouted the loudest about that are not to be heard today.

replies.author: Mattie
replies.text: Patrick For the record I was leaning towards Trump. But this is not a coincidence of a few words. In a sequence of 22 words out of 26 were taken word for word from Michelle's speech. This is just too bad for Melania as I'm sure she had no knowledge of this plagiarism from her writers. Her only mistake was in trying to take credit for writing her own speech in an interview with Matt Lauer just moments before she actually gave the speech. Poor lady I hope she can shake it off. I'm not worried about Donald, he'll shake it off as it never happened.

replies.author: Alyse
replies.text: Basing your vote on a First Lady speech. Very intelligent. ðŸ™„
